A: 1. Jesus taught us some ways to _ (a) Fight (b) Pray (c) Sleep
2. We should pray to God _ (a) Always (b) Sometimes (c) Never
3. Praying without ceasing means we pray to God _ (a) Always (b) Only on Sundays (c) When we feel like it
4. We should pray to God in _ (a) Public (b) Secret (c) Loudly
5. We should not pray because we want people to _ what we are praying about (a) Hear (b) See (c) Ignore
6. If the answer to our prayer has not come, we should keep _ (a) Eating (b) Praying (c) Sleeping
7. We should pray without getting _ (a) Happy (b) Discouraged (c) Tired
8. We should pray in faith without _ (a) Doubt (b) Hope (c) Love
9. We should have _ that God will hear us whenever we pray (a) Fear (b) Belief (c) Anger
10. We should pray for something _ (a) General (b) Random (c) Specific
11. Jesus has power over all things on _ (a) Moon (b) Earth (c) Sun
12. Jesus has power over natural _ (a) Laws (b) Forces (c) Animals
13. Jesus demonstrated his power by calming the _ (a) River (b) Lake (c) Sea
14. There was a great _ which almost sank the ship (a) Rain (b) Storm (c) Fire
15. Jesus spoke to the wind and said '_ be still' (a) Quiet (b) Peace (c) Stop
16. The wind stopped _ after Jesus spoke (a) Slowly (b) Immediately (c) Later
17. Jesus also demonstrated his power by walking on the _ (a) Land (b) Sea (c) Air
18. About how many people followed Jesus to the mountain? (a) Two thousand (b) Three thousand (c) Five thousand
19. Jesus asked one of his _ how they could get bread (a) Enemies (b) Disciples (c) Neighbors
20. A boy had _ loaves of bread and two small fishes (a) Three (b) Five (c) Seven
21. After praying, Jesus gave the food to his _ to give to the people (a) Disciples (b) Parents (c) Friends
22. The people all ate and were _ (a) Hungry (b) Thirsty (c) Satisfied
23. They had _ full baskets of leftovers (a) Ten (b) Twelve (c) Fifteen
24. One person Jesus healed was Peter's _ (a) Brother (b) Mother-in-law (c) Son
25. Jesus healed the _ man (a) Blind (b) Deaf (c) Paralysed
26. One person Jesus raised from the dead was Jairus's _ (a) Son (b) Daughter (c) Wife
27. Jesus raised the _ son from the dead (a) King's (b) Widow's (c) Soldier's
28. The third person Jesus raised from the dead mentioned in the text is _ (a) John (b) Lazarus (c) Mary
29. The memory verse is from Luke _ (a) 6:16 (b) 7:16 (c) 8:16
30. Jesus performed a lot of _ on earth (a) Songs (b) Miracles (c) Dances
B: 1. According to Jesus' teaching, what does it mean to pray without ceasing?
2. What did Jesus say to the wind to calm the storm?
3. How many loaves of bread and fishes did the boy have that Jesus used to feed the multitude?
4. Name one person whom Jesus healed according to the text.
5. What is the memory verse mentioned in the text?
C: 1. Discuss two key teachings of Jesus on how to pray, as outlined in the text.
2. Explain how Jesus demonstrated His power over natural forces, providing specific examples from the text.
3. Describe the miracle of Jesus feeding the five thousand people, including the initial situation, the resources available, and the outcome.
4. List and briefly describe three individuals whom Jesus raised from the dead, according to the provided text.
5. Based on the text, summarize Jesus' overall power over diseases and death.
answers_B: It means we pray to God always.
Five loaves of bread and two small fishes.
Luke 7:16, "A great prophet is risen up among us; and that God has visited his people."
answers_C: Jesus taught us to pray without ceasing, meaning to pray always. He also taught us to pray in secret, not seeking human praise or attention.

Jesus demonstrated His power over natural forces by calming the sea during a great storm by saying "Peace be still," which immediately stopped the wind. He also showed this power by walking on the sea.

When Jesus and His disciples were on a mountain, about five thousand people followed them. Seeing they were hungry, Jesus asked a disciple how to feed them. A boy had five loaves of bread and two small fishes. Jesus prayed over them, and distributed them through His disciples. All ate and were satisfied, with 12 full baskets of leftovers.

Jesus raised Jairus's Daughter, the widow's son, and Lazarus from the dead. Jairus's daughter was raised after her father sought Jesus. The widow's son was raised when Jesus encountered his funeral procession. Lazarus was raised from the tomb after being dead for days.

The text states that Jesus performed many miracles, helping people with His power by healing the sick and raising the dead. This demonstrates His supreme authority and divine power over physical ailments and even death itself.
